en: A glass of red/white wine, please.
A table for one person/two people, please.
Can I just pay a fine now?
Can I look at the menu, please?
Can I look in the kitchen?
Can I make a telephone call?
Can I make international calls here?
Can I use your cell phone?
Can you change a traveler's check for me?
Can you change money for me?
Can you make it "lite", please? (less oil/butter/lard)
Can you show me on the map?
Do you have an English menu?
Do you have any bar snacks?
Do you have any rooms available?
Do you have it in another colour?
Do you have this in my size?
Excuse me, waiter? (getting attention of server)
How much does it cost to get to _____?
How much is a room for one person/two people?
How much is a ticket to *?
How much is a ticket to _____?
How much is it per hour?
How much is it to America/Australia/Britain/Canada?
cn: 打给 美国/澳洲/英国/加拿大 是多少钱?
我是 美国/澳洲/英国/加拿大 公民。

ar: لا أتكلم العربية    /    ما باحكي عربي
أنا لا أفهم    / أنا مش فاهم

en: I don't want it! (useful for people who come up trying to sell you something)
I need to talk to a lawyer.
I want to rent a car.
I want to talk to a lawyer.
I want to talk to the American/Australian/British/Canadian embassy/consulate.
cn: 我希望跟 美国/澳洲/英国/加拿大 的 大使馆/领事馆 联系。

en: Is there someone here who speaks English?
It is nine in the morning.
May I have a bottle of _____?
May I have a cup of _____?
May I have a glass of _____?
May I please ask, what is your name?
May I see the room first?
Please provide me with a carrier-bag.
When does the train/bus for _____ leave?
When will this train/bus arrive in _____?
Where are there a lot of...
Where can I find an Internet cafe?
Where can I get a traveler's check changed?
Where can I get money changed?
Where is an automatic teller machine (ATM)?
they (two people) : هما huma (rarely used out of the most formal Literary Arabic)
